noun.description: Originally: a case of metal, leather, etc., for holding pens; a pen-case. Later also: a writing case.

origin: Late Middle English. From post-classical Latin pennarium pen-case (frequently 1328–1520 in British sources) from penna pen + classical Latin -ārium; compare -er, -ar<br>mid 16th century; earliest use found in Bannatyne Miscellany. From pen + -er<br>mid 17th century. From pen + -er.
